_user_ and Cristina, thanks! I am going to put this up around the neighborhood.
Sounds good, but before you go, let's briefly wrap up what we learned today.
ok. We found out about the description text structure and how it can paint a mental picture for the reader.
Oh yeah! That helps us create a good summary because we know we only need to remember the main idea and the most important descriptions for the writer's purpose. The text maps help with that!
A good summary can help us remember the most important information from the reading. We will keep that in mind when we look at summarizing other text structures.
Alright. If that's it, I'm off to look for Lola.
See everyone soon.
Now let's listen to this car ad.
Cristina, I wrote a summary about Aunt Kerry's symptoms. Is it a good summary to send to her doctor?
Jordan, this summary is not good.
Let me call my grandma and tell her what we did.
_user_ and Jordan, this poster is a good summary.
At the bottom of the screen, you can see a text map. Text maps help us define the important information from a passage.
Do we need to drag the sentences to the text map.
Actually, you don't need to do any dragging. Just press on the sentence, and it will automatically show in the text map.
Let's listen to this email.
_user_ and Cristina, thank you so much for helping me with this email. Now, i really have to go and check up on my aunt. Are we finished?
Jordan, You are very welcome for the help. I hope your aunt is OK. We are almost finished, but before you go, let's briefly wrap up what we learned today.
We found out about the description text structure and how it can paint a mental picture for the reader.

That's right. We have also learned that not all of the details in a text are important. It is our job to decide what the most important descriptions are and how they support the main idea, or the writer's purpose.
Oh yeah! That helps us create a good summary because we know we only need to remember the main idea and the most important descriptions for the writer's purpose. The text maps help with that!
A good summary can help us remember the most important information from the reading. We will come back to this idea when we look at summarizing other text structures.
Wow. sounds almost too fun to be true. We can go now right?
Yes, you can go. Be safe and see both of you next time.
I hope people will now be able to identify Lola if they see her.
Perhaps, we should add one more feature.
Aunt Kerry suffered chest pain, nausea and dizziness
Now, I think we have all the most important details about Lola.
Hold on, we forgot the most important part.
Oh my gosh. Aunt Kerry has one of the heart attack symptoms.
Jordan, take it easy. Let's keep reading.
_user_ and Cristina, thanks! I will contact the owner and take a test drive.
Sounds good.
Let's see what other descriptions should be included.
Let's see the heart attack list.
_user_ and Cristina, I just got an important email from my sister. It says my Aunt Kerry isn't feeling well. I'm pretty upset and I need your help to understand the email.
Jordan, take a deep breath and try not to worry. Let's read the email and see what happened.
Ok, yes. Good idea. Let's read the e-mail.
Item.speech: Ok, yes. Good idea. Let's reed the e-mail.

Item.text: _user_, you can either read to yourself or listen to the audio by pressing the green audio button at the bottom of the tablet.
_user_ and Jordan , hello. Welcome to today's lesson.
Hey everyone. I am glad you are both here, because I need some help understanding this car advertisement I found on Craigslist.
You want to buy a car?
Yes, the car looks nice, but the add is difficult for me to understand.
Jordan, no worries. This is a good example of a descriptive text. We can help you find the most important details that you need to know.
Should we read the ad first?
Yes, let's read the ad first. _user_, you can either read to yourself or listen to the audio by pressing the green audio button at the bottom of the tablet.
This car seems pretty great! But I'm a little overwhelmed with all of the information.
Yes, ads and other descriptive texts can sometimes seem overwhelming because of all the detail. Let's try to make a summary of the important parts.
What other information should we include?
Let's work together to figure that out.
_user_, you can either read to yourself or listen to the audio by pressing the green audio button at the bottom of the tablet.
Now let's briefly wrap up what we learned today.
We found out about the description text structure and how it can paint a mental picture for the reader.

That's right. We have also learned that not all of the details in a text are important. It is our job to decide what the most important descriptions are and how they support the main idea, or the writer's purpose.
Oh yeah! That helps us create a good summary because we know we only need to remember the main idea and the most important descriptions for the writer's purpose. The text maps help with that!
A good summary can help us remember the most important information from the reading. We will keep that in mind when we look at summarizing other text structures. See you both next time.
Oh man. After reading this i'm even more worried. I think I should call Aunt Kerry's doctor. _user_, can I borrow your cell phone?
Jordan, Calm down. Let's see what symptoms she has before calling her doctor.
What other information is given about the car?
Let's look at the text and find out.
_user_ and Cristina, my grandma lost her beloved dog, Lola. I feel so bad for her!
Oh no, how can we help. Have you tried to write a poster to let people know the dog is lost?
Wow, that's a great idea. But, what should be in the poster?
_user_ and I will help you with the poster. The poster will be like a summary of a description of Lola. First, let's think of a title for this poster.
So is Aunt Kerry having a heart attack?
We can try to figure this out together. Here is a list of the symptoms of a heart attack.
But we don't know whether this car is good or not.
Let's see what information this ad provides.
I like this car because it will save gas.
Yes, You can save money that way. Let's see what other information is provided.

Question.text: _user_, which of the highlighted sentences describes a symptom that Aunt Kerry has? Choose a sentence please.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The third sentence describes some symptoms such as abnormal pressure or squeezing pain in her chest.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first two sentences don't describe any symptoms that Aunt Kerry has.

Answer.name: CristinaExplanation
Answer.text: A symptom is a sign of a disease.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which of the highlighted sentences describes a symptom that Aunt Kerry has?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: The first sentence doesn't mention any sign of disease.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: The second sentence only mentions that Kerry is having some discomfort but does not clearly mention any symptoms.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: The third sentence describes some symptoms.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: The second sentence says Kerry isn't feeling comfortable.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I don't think the first sentence mentions any signs of disease.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: The second sentence only mentions that Kerry is having some discomfort but does not clearly mention any symptoms.

Question.text: _user_, which symptom described in the highlighted sentence is also on the list of heart attack symptoms? Please choose your answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: This sentence describes the symptom chest pain. Abnormal pressure isn't on the list.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The other symptoms were not mentioned in the highlighted sentence.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The symptom on the list could be a more specific term for the symptom described in the highlighted sentence.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which symptom described in the highlighted sentence is on the list of heart attack symptoms?

Answer.name: TAHintD
Answer.text: Abnormal pressure could mean that Aunt Kerry is feeling tightness in her chest or like a weight is on her. It doesn't mean stress.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: An upset stomach means belly ache. This symptom isn't mentioned in the highlighted sentence.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: Fatigue means exhaustion. That is not the symptom that Jordan's Aunt Kerry is describing here.

Answer.name: TAHintE
Answer.text: Aunt Kerry is describing pain in her chest. This is different from nausea which means feeling like you may vomit.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: Chest pain is the symptom described in the sentence.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I choose stress.

Answer.name: JordanHintD
Answer.text: Abnormal pressure could mean that Aunt Kerry feels like a weight is on her. I don't think it means stress.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I think upset stomach means something like a belly ache. I do nott see this symptom in the highlighted sentence.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I am pretty sure that fatigue means really tired. I do not think this is what Aunt Kerry is trying to describe.

Answer.name: JordanHintE
Answer.text: I feel like nausea has more to do with throwing up, so I don't think it is the same as tightness in your chest.

Question.text: _user_, which sentence has a description of a symptom that Aunt Kerry is experiencing? Please select that sentence.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The last sentence describes Aunt Kerry as feeling nauseous and lightheaded.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first two sentences don't include any symptoms of disease.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The first two sentences do not give us descriptions that will help us figure out what is wrong.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which sentence has a description of a symptom that Aunt Kerry is experiencing?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: The first sentence doesn't mention any symptoms.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: The second sentence only mentions that Aunt Kerry doesn't want to eat anything. It does not clearly mention a symptom.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think the last sentence describes some symptoms.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I choose the second sentence. It says that Aunt Kerry can't eat anything.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I feel like the first sentence isn't really describing a symptom.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: The second sentence just says Aunt Kerry can't eat anything. That could be for a lot of reasons.

Question.text: _user_, which symptom in the highlighted sentence is on the list of symptoms for heart attack? Please choose an answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: Yes. It is most likely that Aunt Kerry is experiencing nausea.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: So we just have to figure out which one of the symptoms would feel like a combination of both of those things.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Nausea means feeling like you might vomit. Lightheaded means dizzy.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which symptom in the highlighted sentence is on the list for heart attack?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: Nauseous means feeling like you are going to vomit.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Lightheaded means that you feel like the room is spinning.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: Nauseous means feeling like you are going to vomit.

Answer.name: TAHintD
Answer.text: Lightheaded means that you feel like the room is spinning.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it sounds like she has nausea.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: This does not sound good. I am not quite sure what it means though.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: _user_, I think nauseous means feeling like you might vomit, but you do not actually throw up.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: _user_, I think lightheaded means that you feel dizzy.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: _user_, I think nauseous means feeling like you might vomit, but you do not actually throw up.

Answer.name: JordanHintD
Answer.text: _user_, I think lightheaded means that you feel dizzy.

Question.text: _user_, which symptom in the highlighted sentences is on the list of heart attack symptoms? Please select the symptom.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: Fatigue means extremely tired. So the correct symptom of heart attack would be fatigue.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: I think it is similar to the way people feel extremely tired after a long run.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Aunt Kerry's lack of sleep is directly stated in the sentences. We can also see she's exhausted since she describes feeling like she ran a marathon.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which symptom in the highlighted sentences is on the list?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: When Aunt Kerry says she feels like she has run a marathon, it does not mean she has chest pain.

Answer.name: TAHintD
Answer.text: The fact that she did not get any rest this morning is probably not related to stress.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Aunt Kerry describes herself as feeling like she has run a marathon. It sounds like she is really tired which is not the same as having an upset stomach.

Answer.name: TAHintE
Answer.text: Aunt Kerry describes herself as feeling like she has run a marathon. It sounds like she is really tired which is not the same as experiencing nausea.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think that what Cheryl is describing in the e-mail is fatigue.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: This is hard. I'm not sure. Maybe upset stomach?

Answer.name: JordanHintD
Answer.text: I think that if you are stressed, you do not feel like you have run a marathon.

Answer.name: JordanHintE
Answer.text: I didn't think it was nausea, since previous sentences described that symptom.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: It sounds like Aunt Kerry is not able to sleep. I don't think this is the same as having an upset stomach.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I didn't think it was chest pain, since previous sentences described that symptom.

Question.text: _user_, why is this NOT a good summary? Please select the best answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: While this summary tells us some important details from the email, such as Aunt Kerry being tired, the summary is not good because it includes too much extra, unimportant information. # The fact that Aunt Kerry usually eats a soup and sandwich for lunch does not help us understand what is wrong with her.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: Ok, i understand. So a good summary should include all the important descriptions from the e-mail, but not extra information.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: In order to make this a good summary you need to include some of the specific terms that we researched that match Aunt Kerry's descriptions.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, why do you think this summary is not a good one?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: This summary does not include any symptoms from the list of heart attack symptoms.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: This summary does not appear to have any of Aunt Kerry's specific symptoms.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think that the summary has details that are not important. I choose the second answer.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Cristina, I have no idea what the answer is.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I don't think this summary includes any symptoms from the list of heart attack symptoms.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: It seems to me that this summary does not have any of Aunt Kerry's specific symptoms.

Question.text: _user_, what is the best title for this poster? Please choose an answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: Lost Dog $10 Reward is the best title for our poster.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first one has Lola's name, but doesn't tell us what she is.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The second one tells us it is a missing dog but doesn't have anything about the reward.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, what do you think is the best title?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: People may not know what Lola is, so that part of the description is important.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: The second one does not give you a reason to look for the dog.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think the best title might be Lost Dog ten dollar reward.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I'm not sure. Maybe the second one?

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: People who don't know Lola won't know what she is.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: The second one doesn't give you much information.

Question.text: _user_, what information below should be included in the poster? Please click on your answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: It is most important to describe what kind of dog Lola is and how old she is.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: Knowing that Lola enjoys chasing ducks doesn't really help us find her.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: We need to include only the descriptions that are most likely to help people find Lola.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which one of these details should be included in the poster?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: It is cute that she loves walks but it does not help us find her.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: It is fun to watch Lola chase ducks, but it is not a description that will help others find her.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe the first description of Lola?

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: It is true that she loves walks. I think we should include that one.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I guess the fact that she loves walks will not really help us find her.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I love watching her chase ducks, but I don't think it will help us find her.

Question.text: _user_, which description can help people identify Lola?

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The best description is the last one. It tells us Lola's weight and appearance. These unique features will help people identify Lola easily.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first two descriptions are normal for most dogs. They are not unique to Lola.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: We should include the description that is unique to Lola.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which description is unique to Lola? Choose an answer by clicking on the buttons.

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: The first answer is not helpful because it is true of most dogs.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: The second answer is not a good description because it is true of most dogs not just Lola.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I'm pretty sure the last one is the best description of Lola.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: She loves belly rubs. I think that is a good description of Lola.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I don't think it is the first one because that is true of most dogs.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: The second answer is probably not the most unique description of Lola.

Question.text: _user_, which of the following is the most unique description for Lola? Click on your answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The descriptions of where she was last seen are not helpful because they are probably no longer true. The second option is the most helpful.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first and last descriptions tell us where Lola was last seen.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: We should not include descriptions that could not be true anymore.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which of the descriptions will help us find Lola?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: Playing with another dog is a temporary action. This action will probably not continue until people find Lola.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Getting into a grocery store is a temporary action. By the time people see the poster it will probably not be true.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: The description on her collar and tag seems to be the most helpful. I choose the second one.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it might be the first one. She loves other dogs.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: Most likely, she is not still playing with the terrier. I don't think this description is helpful.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: Most likely, she is not still trying to get into the grocery store. I don't think this description is helpful.

Question.text: _user_, which important piece of information is missing from the poster? Click on your answer please.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: That's right, Jordan. The important details are complete when we add the contact information for Lola's owners.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The poster already has Lola's picture and it is probably not helpful to know her favorite food.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: If someone finds Lola it is important that they know who to contact to return her. This is a very important part of the poster.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, what important piece of information is not on the poster?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Knowing her favorite food will not help people find Lola.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: Lola's picture is already on the poster.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: The contact information is missing from the poster!

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe if people know her favorite food they can get her to come with them.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I guess it wouldn't help to know her favorite food.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I think we already have her picture on the poster.

Question.text: _user_, can you tell me why this is a good summary? Please click on an answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: This poster is a good summary because it includes all of the most important descriptions of Lola to help us find her.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: In the poster, we left out the information that wasn't helpful like how much Lola loves walks.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: A good summary should include only the most important information to support the writer's purpose.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, why is this summary good?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: Based on the poster on the right, this summary doesn't include Lola's hobbies.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Based on the poster on the right, this summary doesn't include any information about when Lola was last seen.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the second one because we only included the most important details in the poster.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I am not sure what would make a good summary.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I don't see any of Lola's favorite activities on the poster.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I don't think the poster says anything about where we were when we lost Lola.

Question.text: _user_, which sentence tells us the main idea of this ad? Please click on the sentence.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The first sentence is the main idea because it tells us that the author is trying to persuade people to buy the car.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first sentence is often the main idea.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The main idea is the essential point that the author is trying to make.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: Which sentence tells us the main idea of this ad?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: If the sentence delivers the main idea, the following sentences should support it.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: This sentence is too specific to be the main idea. It seems like supporting information.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think the first sentence tells us the main idea of the ad.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe the third sentence. I want the car to take me where I want to go!

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: This sentence seems more like a detail about the main idea. It is pretty specific.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: This sentence just seems like a description, but not the main point.

Question.text: _user_, what is the most important description in the highlighted sentences? Click on an answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: These two sentences describe one feature. This car gets great gas mileage.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: Oh, I see. The second sentence elaborates on what gas saver means.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The second sentence describes the feature introduced in the first sentence.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: What feature is described in the highlighted sentences?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: The second sentence describes how you can save money on gas in the city. What feature of the car does it support?

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: When this sentence describes the excellent gas mileage in rural areas it is elaborating on a feature of the car. What is that feature?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe the first answer is correct.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe the second answer is correct.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: It seems like the second sentence talks about saving money on gas in the city. That doesn't seem like the main feature.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: The sentence only tells us that the car achieves the best mileage in rural areas. What point does this sentence support?

Question.text: _user_, what is the most important description in the highlighted sentences? Please click on your answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The AC and heat are in great condition, so that makes travel comfortable in any weather.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first answer only mentions the AC, but both the AC and the heat are described in the sentences.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The description should include both the AC and the heat to be complete.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, is one of the sentences supported by the other sentences?

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: The AC is necessary for warm weather but you might want something else when it is cold to be comfortable.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: One of the highlighted sentences says, they make travel comfortable in any weather. What is making travel comfortable in any weather?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: The last option sounds right to me. The second and third sentences support the idea that the AC and heat are in great condition.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the second option. I bet the Honda runs well in any weather.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: It seems like the highlighted sentences describe more than just the AC.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: None of the highlighted sentences say that the car runs well in any weather.

Question.text: _user_, which highlighted sentence gives the best description of the car to someone who may want to buy it? Please select the sentence in the passage that is your answer.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The new tires and brakes are the most attractive to the buyer even though there is some rust.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: It is great that the car is so clean but it would cost less to have the car cleaned than it would to buy new tires and brakes.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: This description should attract the buyer.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: Which highlighted sentence gives the best car description to a future buyer?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: The fact that the car is clean is not as important as the car's other features.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: This sentence does not provide a feature of the car.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the first one because new tires and brakes are expensive!

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I'm not sure, but I like the fact that it is clean. I choose sentence 3.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: Well I'm not sure I should buy a car just because it is clean.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I don't think this sentence has a feature of the car in it.

Question.text: _user_, why is this a good summary of the car ad? Please select your answer below.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: That's right. We need to know that the car can save gas, but also that it has some rust. So the correct answer is the first one. This summary includes all the important car descriptions.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: I think a good summary should probably include both the good and bad features, so you can get a good picture in your mind.

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: A good summary should include the most important information from the ad.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, can you explain why this is a good summary of the ad?

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: The summary should not be limited to the good descriptions.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: A good summary needs to include the unattractive descriptions, if they are important.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think that the first answer is correct. We need to include all the important details, not just the good ones.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the third option. I only need to hear the attractive details about the car.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: This summary describes all the important car details.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: This summary includes the part about the rust, so it includes some unattractive descriptions.
